timeline.bodyText: The only place where this method is called currently in the code is in AlterTableAddPartitionOperation.java. Instead of introducing an addtional RPC, perhaps a better way is to send the Table (ql.metadata.Table) object in this method so that we can pass the tableId directly without getting the table from metastore.
timeline.author: vihangk1
timeline.diffHunk:

   public org.apache.hadoop.hive.metastore.api.Partition getPartition(String dbName, String tableName,

timeline.message: Add tests to ensure validWriteIdList and tableId are sent from HS2 to HMS get_* APIs

timeline.bodyText: I think these annotations are more useful for public APIs. Since Hive.java is not a public API you can just use @VisibleForTesting annotation.
timeline.author: vihangk1
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -5292,6 +5303,16 @@ public synchronized SynchronizedMetaStoreClient getSynchronizedMSC() throws Meta
     return syncMetaStoreClient;
   }
 
+    /**
+   * @return the metastore client for the current thread
+   * @throws MetaException
+   */
+  @LimitedPrivate(value = {"Hive"})

revised_code.chunk:
diff --git a/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/metadata/Hive.java b/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/metadata/Hive.java
index e6fa46cbc5..1a0f242db2 100644
--- a/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/metadata/Hive.java
+++ b/ql/src/java/org/apache/hadoop/hive/ql/metadata/Hive.java

@@ -5303,13 +5301,13 @@ public synchronized SynchronizedMetaStoreClient getSynchronizedMSC() throws Meta
     return syncMetaStoreClient;
   }
 
-    /**
-   * @return the metastore client for the current thread
+  /**
+   * Sets the metastore client for the current thread
    * @throws MetaException
    */
-  @LimitedPrivate(value = {"Hive"})
-  @Unstable
-  public synchronized void setMSC(IMetaStoreClient client) throws MetaException {
+  @VisibleForTesting
+  public synchronized void setMSC(IMetaStoreClient client)
+      throws MetaException {
     metaStoreClient = client;
   }

timeline.bodyText: nit, the name of the variable and its value seems off. Either change the value to ';' or rename the variable to colon.
timeline.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: A more natural place for this class would be in standalone-metastore module. I don't see anything in this class it to be dependent on hive-exec.

timeline.bodyText: I am curious to know what is the current behavior when a non-transactional table is requested. Does it set the table Id too? Also, what happens when we request ValidWriteIdList to HMS for a non-transactional table?
timeline.author: vihangk1

replies.bodyText: HS2 methods have explicit checks to know whether a given table is transactional or not. So, validWriteIdList and tableId are only set for transactional tables.
replies.author: kishendas

replies.bodyText: Okay. Thanks for letting me know.
replies.author: vihangk1

timeline.bodyText: If this is only used for testing purposes would be good to annotate this method with @VisibleForTesting
timeline.author: vihangk1
